name: places/ChIJb7Ss0ARZwokRVGtfq3Ze0-o
formattedAddress: 333 E 38th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 333 E 38th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: One trick pony - epidural or nothing. Poor listening skills, limited diagnostic skill, not particularly interested in patient outcomes and spends 85% of the visit typing.  NYC has an abundance of pain management specialists - likely anyone would be better.  My husband wasted 6 weeks with no relief.

NYC has an abundance of pain management specialists - likely anyone would be better.  My husband wasted 6 weeks with no relief.

originalText.text: Avoid! I saw him 3 years ago and because of NYU politics he is still blocking me from seeing other doctors at NYU (it is becoming more difficult to go outside NYU with the buying up practices with their huge endowment). He didn't listen to me when I told him I had already had epidural shots and they didn't work because he runs an epidural shot mill so everybody gets one whether they need it or not. After the shot he didn't return multiple emails asking what he had injected. More than one subsequent physician told me it was an inappropriate therapy but they couldn't go on record because Dr. Gharibo has too much clout.

originalText.text: Dr. Gharibo is highly skilled no nonsense pain management specialist who does not, like other doctors, write pain med scripts. He suggested a nerve block and PT and I was cautious yet no therapy was working enough to make the pain bearable. He calls you back personally after every step and checks in. He’s highly skilled at injecting the anesthesia and nerve block and thinks through solutions. He also got insurance handled fast as his team works seamlessly. My neurologist recommended him and said he’s the best and very direct. That’s what I want in a doctor.

originalText.text: I saw Dr. Christopher Gharibo on numerous occasions, on the TeleMed and in person for back pain. He took his time, he listened and worked with me on resolving my issues. I felt that I received excellent service by the doctor and the staff is super caring at NYU, from support staff to all the medical personnel. I felt that I was listened to, acknowledged and served at the highest level of professionalism in NYC. Thank you.

originalText.text: What a horrendous experience. I went into his office unable to walk well and in a lot of pain. He just gave me more muscle relaxers and told me I have to wait a few days for insurance to authorize the epidural. So I left, still unable to walk well and even more sedative muscle relaxers. I then get a call about scheduling the epidural to find out that he only does these at 2:30 pm, no later, no earlier. This is absolutely unacceptable. I will never return to NYU Langone.
